intro: Zanthoxylum mezoneurispinosum, commonly known as the spiny zanthoxylum, is a member of the Rutaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. It is native to certain regions of Central America and is typically found in tropical and subtropical environments. The plant features thorny stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a bright red drupe, which contains several seeds and is often consumed by birds and small mammals. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
